oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Earrings of Martha Ottinger Lauderdale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These earrings were give to Martha Ottinger Lauderdale by her husband, James Atkins Lauderdale as he departed for war. He joined Co. B, 8th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA and was killed in the Atlanta Campaign May 27, 1864.; Martha never remarried. The two had a child, Ellen, who was probably never seen by her father. A tintype of James in uniform also survives (newp013).
